results.title: Metformin attenuates antipsychotic-induced metabolic dysfunctions in MK801-induced schizophrenia-like rats.

citations.NLM: Luo C, Wang X, Mao X, Huang H, Liu Y, Zhao J, Zhou H, Liu Z, Li X. Metformin attenuates antipsychotic-induced metabolic dysfunctions in MK801-induced schizophrenia-like rats. Psychopharmacology (Berl). 2020 Aug;237(8):2257-2277. PMID: 32588080

results.title: Recommendations for diagnosis and management of metformin-induced vitamin B12 (Cbl) deficiency.
results.text_hl: In our review, recommendations for diagnosis and management of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@-induced @DISEASE_Immunologic_Deficiency_Syndromes @DISEASE_MESH:D007153 @@@Cbl deficiency@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Drug_Fever</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000092582 @@@MICD@@@) in @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetic@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ based on medical bibliography are presented and discussed.

citations.NLM: Mazokopakis EE, Starakis IK. Recommendations for diagnosis and management of metformin-induced vitamin B12 (Cbl) deficiency. Diabetes Res Clin Pract. 2012 Sep;97(3):359-67. PMID: 22770998
citations.BibTeX: @article{22770998, title={Recommendations for diagnosis and management of metformin-induced vitamin B12 (Cbl) deficiency.}, author={Mazokopakis EE and Starakis IK}, journal={Diabetes Res Clin Pract}, volume={97}, number={3}, pages={359-67}}

results.title: Treatment intensification for patients with type 2 diabetes and poor glycaemic control.
results.text_hl: A higher index HbA1c was associated with early intensification [hazard ratio (HR) 1.18 for HbA1c >=9 to <10% and HR 1.41 for HbA1c >=10% compared with HbA1c >=8 to <9%; p < 0.0001), and later line of therapy was associated with late intensification (HR 0.78 for @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ with one OAD and HR 0.68 for @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ with >=2 @<m>DISEASE_Drug_Fever</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000092582 @@@OADs@@@ compared with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ monotherapy; p < 0.0001).

citations.NLM: Fu AZ, Sheehan JJ. Treatment intensification for patients with type 2 diabetes and poor glycaemic control. Diabetes Obes Metab. 2016 Sep;18(9):892-8. PMID: 27160505
citations.BibTeX: @article{27160505, title={Treatment intensification for patients with type 2 diabetes and poor glycaemic control.}, author={Fu AZ and Sheehan JJ}, journal={Diabetes Obes Metab}, volume={18}, number={9}, pages={892-8}}
